website_summaries.verdict: Sleek and fairly lightweight, this mountain bike holds up well in urban environments and light trail rides.
pros: Easy to assemble, taking less than an hour for most
Tough enough to handle urban environments, with derailleurs that aren’t too delicate
cons: Pedals and saddle are subpar, and some riders opt to replace them, as the plastic pedals can break with rough off-road riding
Wheel rims and hubs may not hold up well to bombing down mountain biking trails
Some replacement parts are difficult to find

customer_reviews.title: Tough worker for the money.  Makes a great urban bike.
customer_reviews.text: Tough, moderatly priced bike, I have been using this mountain bike as an urban bike and it can take a beating. Derailuers are quite good as well as the brakes. Very satisfied for the money. As with most new bikes in this prices range I recommend ordering better pedals, and saddle off the get-go. Other than that... you are good.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Birke

customer_reviews.title: solid bike for light trails
customer_reviews.text: I bought the XS bike frame for my 11 year old son. He is 4 Ft 11 and fits well. I am mechanically inclined and was able to assemble the bike to spec. It feels and rides solidly. This bike is a good value for the $ and a notch above the big box store offerings.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Check your chains.. front and back
customer_reviews.text: The chains got stuck in between the crank, really really deep inside.. requires removal of the crank and on top of that the paints around it ( including the body of the bike ) are all scratched and damaged..
customer_reviews.author: Jude

customer_reviews.title: Best price for premium bike
customer_reviews.text: Best bike I have ever purchased. I would easily compare this and possibly pick this ove my Cannondale. Your will not regret this buy.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Allen

customer_reviews.title: Very solidly built, light casual mountain bike
customer_reviews.text: Really light compared to a $99 Walmart bike. Very well built. I got this over the Talus 3 due to lighter weight and lower complexity (no disc brakes, which my son doesn't really need for casual use).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good bike. Really like it
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good bike. Really like it. The only thing I didn't like was the front tire already had a gash/cut in the wall of the tire out of the box. Still trying to figure out what year the bike model is.
customer_reviews.author: Macario Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the price. First one was stolen but happy to have it back.
customer_reviews.author: PowersportPete

customer_reviews.title: Assembles easily. Could use a better seat
customer_reviews.text: Decent bike. Plastic pedals broke 30 days after purchase. Assembles easily. Could use a better seat too
customer_reviews.author: Greg  Landry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bike for teenage son.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike. Lowest weight bike for my teenage son, setting aside bikes that would cost 2 to 3x more.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Bike arrived quickly and packaging was in good shape. Easy to put together. It took about 20 minutes. The absolutely nicest/quality mountain bike for the cheapest price I could find and I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: JFP

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it but it does need some front derailleur adjustments which I don't know how to do
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: sturdy yet lightweight mountain bike
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this bike! It was easy to assemble with common household tools, though he is a mechanic so assembly was never his big concern. The bike is sturdy but surprisingly lightweight which makes for a pleasant ride. The gears change smoothly and effortlessly, and the brakes are responsive. So far he's only ridden in town rather than off-road, but is a very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Quinn

product_meta.title: Raleigh Bikes Talus 2 Mountain Bike
product_meta.description: When you hop on raleigh's talus 2 to ride down paved paths and streets, you can keep rolling when the Sidewalk ends! at home on dirt, gravel, and pavement, this entry-level mountain bike will keep your adventure going when you decide it's time to head off road and explore the path less travel LED. The upright lightweight aluminum frame provides a comfortable riding position for your neck and lower back, and being upright gives you a better vantage point for spotting any obstacles in your path. The large 27.5" wheels and wide 2" tires help you easily roll over bumps and potholes with confidence. Shimano EZ shift Shifters offer you 21 different gears to get you through whatever may cross your path without having to move your hands off the grips. The raleigh mountain plush saddle ensures that your next ride is a comfy one. Raleigh bicycles are designed around one simple idea: fun. It's an idea that inspired the very first bikes way back in 1887 and continues to inspire how things are done today. Hop on a raleigh and enjoy the ride
feature_bullets: Made for fun riding on pavement and light dirt trails
Designed with a lightweight aluminum frame and upright geometry for a comfortable riding position that's easy on the neck and lower back
Features Big 27.5" wheels with wide 2" tires to roll fast, smooth and confidently on varied terrain
Includes 21 speeds to assist you in getting up (and down) hills
